Name: ROBERT DEVEREUX
Job/Team Function: Overall leadership of the Department, and its day to day operations and the Government's programme of major reform.

Name: DEBBIE ALDER
Job/Team Function: Responsible for delivering an HR service to the Department’s 100,000 employees and management. Ensures that this HR service is cost-effective and supports the customer-focused delivery of the Department’s activities.

Name: HOWARD SHIPLEE
Job Title: Director General for the Universal Credit Programme
Job/Team Function: Responsible for managing the progressive national rollout and live support of the Universal Credit Pathfinder Service.

Name: JEREMY MOORE
Job Title: Director General Strategy,Policy and Analysis Group
Job/Team Function: Advises and supports Ministers and the Executive Team in the formulation and deliverability of policy relating to the Government’s welfare, work and pension reforms as well as the social justice agenda, including looking beyond the individual reforms already underway.

Name: KEVIN CUNNINGTON
Job Title: Director General for Digital Transformation Group
Job/Team Function: Digital Transformation Group is responsible for defining the Department's vision, business strategy and future business design; defining the transformation roadmap and delivery methods; managing, assuring, and leading the Department's portfolio of change and assessing change proposals; supporting and building secure, common digital services with embedded customer insight; defining new capability requirements and supporting their development.

Name: MIKE DRIVER
Job Title: Director General, Finance and Chief Financial Officer
Job/Team Function: Responsible for financial planning, performance management, procurement, estates provision, investment portfolio and risk assurance across the Department. Responsible for the financial control environment for benefit payments totalling over £150 billion and for the departmental financial management processes controlling a Departmental Expenditure limit of £7.8 billion. Holds direct budgetary responsibility for an operating and capital budget of £600m.

Name: NOEL SHANAHAN
Job Title: Director General, DWP Operations and SRO for the Child Maintenance Change Programme
Job/Team Function: Responsible for the development and provision of DWP's services to the public, including those provided by partners or under contract. Also Senior Responsible Owner for the Child Maintenance Change Programme.

Name: ALISON STANLEY
Job Title: HR Director, Civil Service Employee Policy
Job/Team Function: Civil Service Employee Policy was set up on 01 April 2011 as one of the Expert Services under Civil Service HR. We provide a professional and specialist service across government departments to develop and maintain the civil service framework of people policies and practice. Working closely with government departments, we deliver simplified, rationalised policies, including guidance and support with implementation. We also offer an Expert Advice Service to deliver the Civil Service Reform priorities to Cabinet Office and departments.

Name: ANDREW FORZANI
Job/Team Function: Accountable for all DWP commercial activity and performance, providing commercial assurance for annual business worth around £3.4 billion.  Leadership of a Commercial Directorate covering sourcing and contract management of contracts to deliver best VFM services to DWP which support DWP operational, efficiency and Welfare Reform objectives.  Leadership of the DWP procurement profession and DWP commercial, sustainability and travel policy and strategies.   Crown Commercial Representative for Tata.  Key objectives are to improve DWP commercial capability, improve DWP contract service delivery, reduce DWP third party expenditure and use DWP procurement to promote economic growth.

Name: ANGELA MACDONALD
Job/Team Function: Operational Excellence has 2 primary roles: accountability for the service integrity of the benefit system (fraud and error and security) and for driving up operational excellence across the whole of operations. The Directorate is split into 4 areas: Fraud & Error Service, Central Operations, Service Design & Management and Change & Implementation.

Name: ANN HARRIS
Job/Team Function: The Programme Director is responsible, and held acount by the SRO, for the successful delivery of the day to day running of the Programme, delivery of the Programme objectives, monitoring benefits realised against the Business case.The Programme Director is also responsible for the overall integrity and coherence of the Programme, providing leadership, direct line management of project strand leads, chair governance boards/meetings and engagement with key internal and external delivery partners and stakeholders.

Name: BILL GUNNYEON
Job/Team Function: Responsible for medical and health related advice to Ministers and the Department; for quality of all medical related work including oversight of quality of work of medical services contractor; for medical and health related policy within the Department;  for leading the health, work and wellbeing agenda on behalf of the Department; for oversight of all science based research as Departmental Chief Scientific Adviser; and for external relationships with healthcare professional bodies and other key stakeholders.

Name: CHARLOTTE CLARK
Job/Team Function: Responsible for developing a regime that supports increased pension saving and minimises the burden on employers. Responsibility for delivering a major reform  starting in October 2012 when on a staged basis all employers, starting with the largest, will be required to automatically enrol their work force into a pension. Unless the employee chooses to opt out employer and employee will be required to make a minimum contribution to the pension. The team are overseeing the development of a new low cost pension – National Employment Savings Trust. The team is also responsible, with the Pensions Regulator and the Pension Protection Fund for ensuring an effective regime for pension protection.

Name: CHRIS HAYES
Job/Team Function: Responsible for leading on the overall DWP strategy for the labour market for now and under Universal Credit; the labour market regimes for working age claimants; and DWP work across government and with external partners to achieve better outcomes for young people and working age claimants.

Name: CHRISTINE FORSTER
Job/Team Function: The Operations Director is responsible for providing direction to the operation of the current statutory schemes and for the delivery of performance indicators and service standards.  This means delivering improved client service whilst continuing to achieve efficiencies.  Responsible for influencing the design, development and content of the new statutory scheme programmes to ensure they are fit for purpose and deliver planned efficiencies and operational management of the new scheme following its introduction.

Name: DAVID FRAZER
Job Title: Director of Information, Governance and Security
Job/Team Function: Responsible for helping DWP to make best use of its information, whilst complying with obligations to keep it safe, secure and used only where we have legal powers to do so. The Directorate provides a range of services to support this, including the production of statistics; management information; information architecture; analytical data bases; data matching; records management; and library services . It also provides the department with expert advice on security;  business continuity; policies on information; its governance framework; and managing relationships with its arms length bodies and the devolved administrations.

Name: GRAEME WALLACE
Job/Team Function: Responsible for the payment of State Pension, Attendance Allowance and Carers Allowance. Pay out £98 billion annually including; £79.9 billion in State Pension (SP) to 12.6 million customers; £7.7 billion in Pension Credit (PC) to 2.5 million customers; £5.5 billion in Attendance Allowance (AA) to 1.6 million customers; £2.8 billion in ‘one-off payments’ (Winter Fuel, Christmas Bonus etc); and £1.9 billion in Carer’s Allowance (CA) to 633,000 households. processing 5,500 Claims, and 29,000 Change of Circs. Includes administering State Pension to 1.2 million customers and Working Age benefits to 20,000 customers in 210 countries. Also handle 740,000 calls per year from Working Age customers, and issue 500,000 Individual Pension Statements and 70,000 Pension Traces. Also work with over 400 Pension providers to issue 4 million Combined Pensions Statements a year to Future Pensioners

Name: IAN PAVEY
Job/Team Function: To provide appropriate HR interventions to enable the delivery of the department's major change programmes, to manage the people impacts of change and the delivery of the people plan. Also to provide HR Business partner services to the Change functions and programmes.

Name: IAN WRIGHT
Job/Team Function: The Change Directorate leads the implementation of major change projects, ensuring that projects are delivered to time and to budget.

Name: JACINDA HUMPHRY
Job Title: Director, Departmental Planning and Performance Management
Job/Team Function: Leads negotiations with HM Treasury on Departmental funding; advises Ministers and the Executive team on the allocation and management of resources across the Department; reports internally and externally on the Department’s performance; and provides financial, planning and performance management support to the Department’s Strategy function.

Name: JASON FEENEY
Job/Team Function: Responsible for the delivery of all working age benefits including Jobseekers Allowance, Employment Support Allowance, Income Support, Disability Living Allowance and Personal Independence Payment. Accountable for the accurate payment of c.£30 billion of expenditure and the leadership of 22,000 staff across 72 sites. Senior Responsible Owner for Personal Independence Payment, Appeals Reform and Spend to Save.

Name: JOHN PORTEOUS
Job/Team Function: To lead a qualified team of finance professionals to ensure that the Department delivers value for money across the Corporate Centre and Change portfolio.

Name: JOHN-PAUL MARKS
Job/Team Function: To lead the Programme Management function to provide planning and programme controls that secure integrated delivery and robust monitoring; develop, maintain and execute the programme’s stakeholder & partner management strategy; lead the programme’s response to the 2013 People Survey; build the programme’s internal communications activity.

Name: JON FUNDREY
Job/Team Function: Financial Control provides regular financial and performance reports to business partners, enabling them to support the business to manage resources, control costs and drive performance.We produce the Department’s Resource Accounts; advise on risk and control; provide banking services, resolve payment issues and manage the relationship with the department’s shared service provider

Name: JONATHAN LINDLEY
Job Title: Director, Programme & Project Core Services, DWP IT
Job/Team Function: Accountable for delivery of consistent core services to IT Project Managers in DWP, and for liaison with Business Change Directors.

Name: JONATHAN RUSSELL
Job/Team Function: Responsible for (1) the development & delivery of HR Policy including Pay & Reward strategy; (2) the provision of services on HR performance & resource planning, business & HR management intelligence; (3) the management of a range of departmental health/ wellbeing contracts covering 17 Govt Departments; (4) the leadership of the DWP HR Casework Service, Reasonable Adjustments Team & the HR Mediation/ Investigation Service; (5) the lead on Employee Relations and Health & Safety; (6) to ensure effective & efficient provision of services provided by Shared Services in DWP & X-government & compliance to Departmental governance & assurance requirements; the effective & efficient service provision from Civil Service Learning; Civil Service Resourcing, MyCSP  & (7) to oversee the strategic direction & delivery of the DWP & cross-Civil Service Diversity & Equality agenda.

Name: JUSTIN RUSSELL
Job/Team Function: Responsibility for policy development and programme delivery in relation to Employment Support Allowance and Work Capability Assessment.

Name: KAREN GOSDEN
Job/Team Function:
Responsible for, Internal and external partner and stakeholder management including: Other Government Departments, Devolved administrations, 
Local Authorities, Ministers and Lobby Groups. Briefing and support for, Parliamentary correspondence, Freedom of Information etc Internal and external communications.

Name: KATHRYN PRITCHARD
Job Title: Director of HR Strategy & Organisation Development
Job/Team Function: Lead the development & delivery of the DWP People Strategy & operating model for HR.  Provide strategic & functional leadership to the Corporate HR Business Partners, including driving through organisational changes & providing the ‘voice’ of the Corporate Centre to the HR Executive team.  Provide strategic HR support to change activities across the Department through the Change Programme and other major programmes of change within the Department.  Provide effective & efficient processes for prioritising the work of the HR Function and the allocation of HR resources to key Departmental priorities.  Lead the work on defining, agreeing and monitoring the performance framework for HR ensuring that the outcomes delivered by HR support business performance.  Act as the Finance Director and Business support office for Corporate HR.

Name: KENNY ROBERTSON
Job/Team Function: Accountable for: DWP IT Strategy and Architecture and financial, delivery and operational performance of IT systems and services of; corporate business; Shared Services; and DWP Cross-Government IT systems and services.

Name: MARK FISHER
Job/Team Function: Responsible for leading the DWP team supporting the Secretary of State for Work and Pensions in respect of his cross-Government responsibilities for social justice and child poverty.

Name: MARK RIPLEY
Job/Team Function: Delivery of a professional Internal Audit service to provide an independent view on the adequacy and effectiveness of the Department’s governance, risk and control arrangements. Establishment of the European Social Fund Audit Authority for the England and Gibraltar programme, in accordance with EC requirements. Provision of independent and robust investigation of serious fraud and wrongdoing by the Department’s staff and contractors.

Name: MARY PATTISON
Job/Team Function: The Directorate is responsible for State Pensions policy and legislation, supporting Ministers in their overall reform of the State Pensions system and developing and modelling options for reform of the State Pensions system in support of Ministerial objectives of equality and fairness and Older People & the Ageing Society Strategy Division.

Name: MIKE BAKER
Job/Team Function: Accountable for the operational delivery of Universal Credit services to UK citizens.

Name: MIKE TRURAN
Job/Team Function: The Service Delivery Director takes overall leadership and accountability for the success of DWP IT services by defining, maintaining and improving those services, managing the overall performance and supporting and assuring delivery of new services. Manages stakeholder requirements via best value from the Department’s suppliers and delivery of a modern IT operations capability and industry standard best practice.

Name: MYRTLE LLOYD
Job/Team Function: The team is accountable for the delivery and management of DWP services across a virtual, multi-channel network comprising telephone and digital services. They are responsible for ensuring that these services are delivered efficiently and coherently to required customer service standards, ensuring that business targets and objectives are met and constantly measured for sustained performance improvement. The team also has responsibility for driving the transformation of DWP business from a face to face and telephony business to one where online channels become the contact method of choice for customers and claimants, where appropriate.

Name: NEIL COULING
Job/Team Function: Responsible for the delivery of face-to-face services through Jobcentres, partnerships, and the visiting service. Accountable for the overall Working Age customer experience, ensuring coherence across the services provided to working age claimants by the Network Services Director, the Contracted Customer Services Director, the Benefits Director and the Operational Excellence Director. Personally accountable as: Senior Responsible Owner (SRO) for the Labour Market change programme and Earned Autonomy, which is delivering greater flexibility for Jobcentre Plus Districts;  Senior User Executive for the Universal Credit Programme, helping to ensure the voice of Operations is properly represented and that proposals are deliverable.

Name: PAUL MCCOMB
Job Title: Principal Private Secretary to the Secretary of State/running DWP Private Office
Job/Team Function: Provision of advice and support to the Secretary of State, Departmental Ministers, the Permanent Secretary and Departmental Board.

Name: PETE SEARLE
Job/Team Function: My team leads the development and maintenance of policy for most of the main benefits for people of working age, including Universal Credit, Jobseeker's Allowance, Employment and Support Allowance and Housing Benefit.

Name: RICHARD CASEBY
Job/Team Function: Covering the Department's press office, internal communications, marketing and PR.

Name: SARAH COX
Job/Team Function: Responsible for ensuring that robust, transparent and deliverable programme plans are in place and that programme momentum is maintained.   Also responsible for ensuring that joint and collective accountabilities are clear, that commissioning arrangements are appropriately specified and that the right level of timely direction is given across the whole programme.

Name: SARAH SCULLION
Job/Team Function: The HR Director Operations' accountability is to contribute to the delivery of the Operational Business Targets through the provision of HR business partner services and the implementation of the people strategy.

Name: SIMON MCKINNON
Job/Team Function: The Information and Technology Directorate is responsible for ensuring that the Child Maintenance Group current and future Information Technology and Information Management needs are met. The Directorate provides local IT support, telephony services, and operational support for the Child Maintenance Group's current business applications. The Directorate is also supporting the Child Maintenance Group's change programme, building with third parties a range of applications for the new child maintenance scheme. In addition, the directorate provides information assurance and IT security services to protect information and systems within the Child Maintenance Group.

Name: SIMON TSE
Job/Team Function: Health Services Directorate is responsible for managing and continuously improving the performance of Health and Disability Assessment providers, especially in the key areas of capacity, productivity and value for money. We have an important role in working with our contracted partners to develop closer working relationships, identify and introduce process improvements and provide an effective link between contracted service providers and DWP Operations.

Name: STEVE BUCKINGHAM
Job/Team Function: Leading the Finance Operations Directorate, ensuring that effective financial management and planning and performance management regimes are in place and that they support effective decision-making through high quality analysis, challenge, advice, and reporting.Ensuring Value for Money is considered at all levels of Operations and that an effective link is achieved between productivity, unit costing and other planning and financial activities. Leading all financial matters within CMG including financial management, reporting, accounting and business performance reporting and ensuring that value for money is delivered. Responsible for leading the Commission’s commercial and supplier relationship activities and contributing to the future direction of the organisation by offering advice to the Executive Team and Ministers, and delivering CMG’s planning, analysis, management information and research activities.

Name: STEVE RILEY
Job/Team Function: Accountable to the Customer Businesses for the provison of all IT services. Accountable to Customer Bsuinesses and DWO CIO to ensure that IT Budgets are spent appropriately. Accountable for managing the demand from the Customer  Business. Working in collboration with CIT supply side directors, is accountable for ensuring that IT performance meets Customer expectations & agreed service levels & targets.

Name: SUE MOORE
Job Title: Director of DWP Portfolio Management Unit
Job/Team Function: Portfolio Management Unit plays a key role in managing the end-to-end change process & provides independent assurance to the DWP Executive Team (ET) through the Portfolio Board (PB) & the Portfolio Management Committee (PMC) whilst enabling the successful delivery of the department’s change portfolio. Within PMU the Contract Approvals team manage the processes for both internal ministerial and external CO contract approvals. PMU aspires to be an exemplar in Portfolio Management by building our professional capability; managing the flexible Change Resource Pool, providing expert advice to influence decision making, and working collaboratively across DWP and with all the change programmes

Name: SUSAN PARK
Job/Team Function: Responsible for the day to day running of Child Maintenance Group & its operations, change, corporate affairs and customer functions.

Name: TOM MCCORMACK
Job/Team Function: The Programme Delivery Director is responsible for driving delivery of the Child Maintenance change programme, with lead responsibilities including delivery assurance; project planning and interdependencies; programme assurance and reporting; risks and issues management; and programme resource planning.  The Director also has responsibility for People and Capability programme deliverables, including organisation design; workforce planning and people allocation; content product delivery and live like testing; business preparation; and implementation control.  The Director also acts as deputy for the CMG Change Director.

Name: TRACEY WALTHO
Job/Team Function: Leads on health and safety strategy across Government, including advice to Ministers on funding and objectives for the Health and Safety Executive. Also leads a range of programmes to improve health in the workplace and to compensate people who are injured at work.

Name: TREVOR HUDDLESTON
Job/Team Function: This post is responsible for the co-ordination, delivery and quality assurance of all analysis across DWP. Analytical teams: (a) contribute to the process of evidence based policy development and delivery design; (b) help to monitor and evaluate the impacts of Departmental policies; (c) provide analytical information to support the Parliamentary and legislative process; (d)  provide forecasts of benefit expenditure to support HMT's sound planning of the Government finances.

Name: Vacant
Job/Team Function: Ensure the development and delivery of all IT application developments for the DWP Group to time, cost and quality. Application development spend has a typical annual budget range of between £200m to £400m.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Universal Credit Pathfinder Delivery Director. Key responsibilities are to plan the delivery and implementation of the Pathfinder service for Universal Credit, beginning a controlled rollout from April 2013 and managing rollout to progressive sites beyond the initial implementation. As part of that delivery, develop and implement Pathfinder live operational processes, and jointly lead and manage the Pathfinder UC service with DWP operational colleagues, ensuring the service is available and operates effectively, managing and capturing issues as they arise. As Pathfinder is designed to allow Universal Credit to learn from operational experience, ensure formal evaluation and lessons learned are captured in order to inform the future Universal Credit service.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Central Analytical Division (CAD) develops and evaluates analysis that is cross cutting across DWP and links to wider Government initiatives.  Main responsibilities include: a) Co-ordinating the overall analysis of poverty across DWP; b) Horizon scanning, both within the Department and across Government; c) Improving the quality and policy impact of DWP evaluations; d) Planning and prioritising externally commissioned research and evaluations; e) Trialling co-ordination across DWP; f) Security Assurance for Research and Analysis (SARA); g) Quality-assuring the analysis presented in DWP Impact Assessments; h) Maintaining and developing the DWP Social Cost-Benefit Analysis Framework

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Responsible for definition of the future business design of DWP to deliver the department's business strategy.  Responsible for creating the joined-up transformation roadmap to achieve this target design.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: The IT Services team provides operational service management for the Child Maintenance Group's current applications and infrastructure. The team is responsible for incident, problem, availability, change request and service level management. Working with our IT suppliers, it ensures that our systems meet business needs in a cost effective manner. The team also manages and operates the Live Running IT Costs and Budget.

Name: N/D
Job Title: Deputy Director, Work, Welfare & Wellbeing in Later Life
Job/Team Function: Strategy on: up-rating of social security benefits and State pensions; employment, welfare benefits and wellbeing for older people; extending working life; combatting pensioner poverty and material deprivation among older people; and engagement with older people. Maintenance and reform of Pension Credit. Maintenance of universal pensioner benefits. Income aspects of combatting fuel poverty, including operation of the Warm Home Discount Scheme.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: We support DWP Operations in achieving its objectives by ensuring it safeguards its information assets and promotes responsible behaviour and ensures suitable and sufficient control measures are in place to manage and mitigate Health & Safety risk.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Responsible for providing policy advice to Ministers on Housing Benefit, Council Tax Benefit and Support for Mortgage Interest, and the housing element of Universal Credit and Pension Credit.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Head of Profession for Contact Centre Services, leading a national network of 32 Contact Centres, delivering service to Working Age Customers & Employers

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Managing all contracted employment programmes delivered by third party providers on behalf of the Department.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: The team is responsible for deciding how European Social Fund money should be spent in England and Gibraltar and for managing the expenditure by supporting and checking providers and submitting claims to the European Commission.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Responsible for providing strategic HR advice and support to the Strategy Group in addressing business requirements.  Implementing strategies to deliver the right people in the right place at the right time with the right skills and to increase organisational performance and effectiveness.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Debt Management is responsible for collecting Debt and Compensation on behalf of DWP, Local Authorities, other Government Departments and the NHS. It also administers the Integrated Loan Scheme on behalf of the Home Office. 1800 staff are primarily housed in 9 locations and forms part of DWP Finance Group Directorate.

Name: N/D
Job Title: Deputy Director of Communications Universal Credit
Job/Team Function: Responsible for leading the development and delivery of high quality and innovative communication strategies and plans to support the Government’s business delivery objectives on Universal Credit. Provide expert advice to senior internal and external stakeholders on communications and act as senior Business Partner to the Universal Credit Programme.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: To deliver DWP's programme of Business Change that will be enabled by digitally based projects to help the Department achieve its goal of “Digital by Default”.

Name: N/D
Job Title: Work Services Director, London & Home Counties
Job/Team Function: The main purpose of the Work Services Director role is to drive performance across the Jobcentre network, and to provide senior leadership across London and Home Counties. Ultimately accountable for the end to end customer experience and customer services delivered through local Jobcentres and other service outlets, including advisory services, financial assessment and help with job search; ensuring that all face to face customer contacts are undertaken to required standards, within budget, headcount and against all agreed operational targets. Further accountable for services to employers and for relationships with key partners to support the successful delivery of DWP objectives.
Unit: Operations - Work Services London & Home Counties

Job Title: Deputy Director, Performance and Value for Money, Finance Group
Job/Team Function: Responsible for shaping DWP’s strategic approach to Performance and Value for Money from the finance perspective and achieving optimal outcomes

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: The team owns the overall strategic vision for the DWP and connects people working on strategy with operations by making sure that the strategy developed is deliverable and that what the strategy says is done.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Sitting within the Universal Credit Programme, but responsible for ensuring the end-to-end security delivery capability is in place to provide secure online and other services for both Universal Credit and the wider Department.

Name: N/D
Job Title: Head of Feedback, Legislation and Decision Making Division
Job/Team Function: Our role is to respond professionally to feedback (correspondence, complaints, appeals) about the Department’s services; to give guidance to the Department’s front-line decision-makers; and to promote appropriate regulation and effective management of legislation.

Name: N/D
Job Title: Deputy Director, Labour Market Partnerships Division
Job/Team Function: Labour Market Partnerships Division leads on defining and shaping strategic partnerships to meet the needs of employers and localities and develop the skills of workless people to help more people back into employment. It does this by encouraging and facilitating the coherent delivery of services between DWP and other partners, whether they be in the public, private or voluntary and community sectors.

Name: N/D
Job Title: Lead Analyst, Universal Credits and Working Age
Job/Team Function: Providing the evidence and analysis to support the development of policy and delivery for Universal Credit, Housing Benefits and Working Age Benefits.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: This team are responsible for the delivery of elements of the new child maintenance scheme. This includes organisation design, site strategy and  third party contracts.

I am also the Departmental Security Officer (DSO), a mandated Cabinet Office role.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: The team supports the delivery of Housing Benefit and Council Tax Benefit, allocating and managing the DWP funding to local authorities. We support local authority housing costs teams in preparing for the changes that Universal Credit and welfare reform will bring.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: The team supports the delivery of Housing Benefit and Council Tax Benefit, allocating and managing the DWP funding to local authorities. We support local authority housing costs teams in preparing for the changes that Universal Credit and welfare reform will bring.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Accountable to the Director of Work Services for all customer services delivered through Jobcentres and other local service outlets, including advisory services, financial assessment and help with job search.  The post holder is accountable for the end-to-end customer experience in the Group; ensuring that all face to face customer service is undertaken to required standards; within budget and headcount; and for delivering against all agreed operational targets and measures. The main purpose of the role is to drive performance across the Jobcentre network, supporting claimants into work and to provide senior leadership across the Group.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Delivery of IT infrastructure & security capabilities is support of Universal Credit

Working closely with government departments, we deliver simplified, rationalised policies, including guidance and support with implementation. We also offer an Expert Advice Service to deliver the Civil Service Reform priorities to Cabinet Office and departments.

Responsible for Requirement Management setting across application delivery area.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: (1) Directing and developing creative, insight-driven communication strategies that meet business objectives;  (2) Implementing these strategies, with accountability for delivering value for money from budgets running into millions of pounds; (3) The delivery of communications across the Directorate by accurately forecasting resource requirements; (4) Leading and championing the translation of complex strategies, issues and information into clear and simple communications objectives; the development of compelling and targeted propositions; and the use of appropriate channels; and (5) Scanning and interpreting the political and social landscape to identify the reputational risks associated with communications activities.

Name: N/D
Job Title: Work Services Director, North East England

Name: N/D

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: To lead the Programme Management function to provide planning and programme controls that secure integrated delivery and robust monitoring; develop, maintain and execute the programme’s stakeholder & partner management strategy; lead the programme’s response to the 2013 People Survey; build the programme’s internal communications activity.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: The Policy division is made up of three teams: Policy Team – Ensuring the law governing child support is fit for purpose and the Child Maintenance Group's policies and procedures, and handling of individual cases are in line with the law and reflect the Government's strategic intent; Advice and Guidance Team - Providing support to frontline colleagues to ensure that child support cases are handled in line with Child Maintenance policies and procedures; Judicial Review Team – Ensuring those cases on which we face escalated legal action are managed in line with legal advice and court requirements.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: The team is responsible for resourcing,  workforce management, exit governance and selection review.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: DWP Insight develops and leverages our comprehensive understanding of the needs and behaviours of our service users (claimants, customers, staff, empoyers, intermediaries) in order to ensure the Department: - drives behaviour change to achieve the stated policy and service outcomes and creates more effective policies and services minimising cost to the Department, its users and the taxpayer.

Name: N/D
Job Title: Head of Quality Project, Operational Excellence Directorate
Job/Team Function: Responsible for introducing and embedding a new quality framework for DWP Operations so that we improve the customer experience and reduce failure demand

Name: N/D
Job Title: Head of DWP F&C Business Management and Improvement
Job/Team Function:

Name: N/D

Name: N/D

Name: N/D

Working closely with government departments, we deliver simplified, rationalised policies, including guidance and support with implementation.  We also offer an Expert Advice Service to deliver the priorities of the strategic centre (Cabinet Office, HM Treasury, Treasury Solicitors) and departments.

Name: N/D

Name: N/D

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Supports the IT Director in his accountabilities to provide DWP IT Businesses with their IT requirements, providing suitable IT systems and services that allow DWP staff to deliver services to DWP’s Customers and Claimants.

Lead on structural and cross cutting benefit issues such as means testing and passporting.

Also handles Information Asset Co-ordination for Finance.

Name: N/D

The team also leads on the development of the Civil Service diversity strategy for the workforce and delivery of the Government’s Social Mobility Internship Scheme.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function:
The Child Maintenance Options service provides free, impartial information on child maintenance arrangements, and supports parents to make informed decisions about the child maintenance arrangement most suited to their circumstances, whether this is a family-based or statutory arrangement or one made through the courts. 

Child Maintenance Options is available by phone, web or, for those most in need of more personalised help, through a face-to-face service. The Child Maintenance Options team in the Child Maintenance Group manages all aspects of the service from performance to service development.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: To provide advice on handling media for the department and for Ministers. To answer questions from journalists about the work of the department. To handle the media element of announcements, speeches and visits by the Ministerial team and Permanent Secretary.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Providing advice support and challenge to business leaders in the area of risk management and internal control and reporting levels of compliance with key internal policies to provide assurance that the system of internal control is effective.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Responsible for the delivery of a programme of change to ensure that the current and future welfare system operates in an environment where fraud, error and debt is eradicated or minimised.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Leadership of the Digital Application Delivery and Support Stream(DADS) on the IT Transformation Programme(ITTP). Name: N/D

Ensure that regulation of work-based pensions increases member and employer confidence in the security of benefits and quality of pension scheme administration while considering the burden on sponsoring employers and effects on wider economy. Ensure that the Financial Assistance Scheme and the Pension Protection Fund provide effective compensation or assistance to members of pension schemes which wind up under-funded.

This will include procurement of Information and Communication Technology and other services and managing the impact on other commercial arrangements within and outside DWP.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: The  Enforcement Director is responsible for re-establishing compliance on the current and new child maintenance schemes through debt enforcement actions: negotiation and imposing deduction from earning orders where required.  On cases where debt enforcement action has failed, responsible for re-establishing compliance using measures including charging orders, third party debt orders, obtaining Liability Orders for debt through the Courts, driving licence removal and even the possibility of imprisonment.

They drive performance improvement across the Jobcentre network, and provide senior leadership across the Group; delivering and championing key government initiatives to help get Britain back to work. They are also responsible for national engagement with employers.

Name: N/D

- providing assurance of information risks,

- develop and deliver a 'data warehouse', business intelligence and other management information systems and
- maintain the Child Maintenance Group's data model.

Also management of teams that plan and manage the DWP Commercial Directorate, including work prioritisation, resource management and people development. Key objectives are reducing procurement costs, lean processes, maximising commercial assurance and value for money for the taxpayer and achievement of DWP sustainability, climate change and carbon reduction targets.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: The purpose of the Social Justice Policy team is to develop policy on family-related aspects of Social Justice by identifying the root causes of disadvantage that follow from family challenges, and to use that knowledge to prevent disadvantage from arising and to help people turn their lives around where it does.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Universal Jobmatch was launched in November 2012 and is one of the largest jobsites in the UK. DWP has made UJ part of the government’s plan for providing easy online access to government services for all and it is available to all UK employers and job seekers, 24 hours a day, 7 days a week. Universal Jobmatch streamlines our existing services for employers, is available to all people looking for work whether they are claiming benefits or in work, and empowers claimants to take more responsibility for their jobsearch and get more targeted support from advisers. All services offered to jobseekers or employers/recruiters are available free of charge at the point of contact.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Fraud Investigation Service investigates potential fraudulent attacks against all benefits owned by DWP or administered on behalf of DWP. It works in partnership with Local Authorities, other Government Departments, including HMRC, the Police and other relevant bodies. It also conducts financial investigations, referred by a criminal investigator or in accordance with directives from the courts with a view to recovering money illegally obtained through criminal activity.

Name: N/D
Job Title: Head of Information Management, Devolution and Governance Division
Job/Team Function: Information Management, Devolution and Governance Division enables the DWP to use the information it is responsible for effectively and lawfully. When it is appropriate the Division facilitates the release of information into the public domain. Its centres of expertise also ensure the Department’s stewardship teams exercise appropriate oversight over DWP's Non–Departmental Public Bodies and support DWP in developing successful relationships with the UK’s devolved governments in Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland. Additionally the Division's governance policies and assurance controls ensure Departmental accountabilities are defined, assurance controls are thorough and challenged, following best practice and mandatory policy.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: The current role of the EUIA division is to promote UK employment, labour market and social policies across the EU and internationally; shape European and international rules, standards and services in the field of employment and social affairs to be as effective, proportionate and evidence-based as possible; and, manage policy as regards migrants’ access to the UK benefit system.

Name: N/D

Name: N/D
Job Title: Head of Universal Credit, Business Process
Job/Team Function: To develop the business processes and business products that are required to support Universal Credit delivery.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Expert domain for the analysis and interpretation of regional, national and international labour market trends, including the monthly labour market National Statistics, the department’s overall approach to employment policy and cross government working on labour market issues.

Name: N/D
Job Title: Deputy Director, Universal Credit Pathfinder & Piloting
Job/Team Function: Managing the progressive national rollout and live support of the Universal Credit Pathfinder Service.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Measurement of fraud and error in the benefits system (under and over-payments) and publication of related National Statistics; Compilation of National and other official statistics relating to benefits and claimants and related analyses in support of policy development; Measurement of incomes and poverty, including child, working-age and pensioner poverty and income inequality through the Family Resources Survey; Departmental lead for the Wealth and Assets Survey, the English Longitudinal Study of Ageing, the Life Opportunities Survey, and related analyses. Deputy Head of Profession for statistics: upholding professional standards including the Code of Practice for Official Statistics.

Name: N/D
Job Title: Deputy Director Civil Service Employee Policy
Job/Team Function: Civil Service Employee Policy was set up on 01 April 2011 as one of the Expert Services under Civil Service HR. We provide a professional and specialist service across government departments to develop and maintain the civil service framework of people policies and practice. Working closely with government departments, we deliver simplified, rationalised policies, including guidance and support with implementation. We also offer an Expert Advice Service to deliver the Civil Service Reform priorities to Cabinet Office and departments.

Name: N/D
Job Title: Deputy Director of Projects, ITPD, DWP
Job/Team Function: The projects cover all business areas including internal financial systems, infrastructure upgrades, labour market initiatives such as Universal Jobmatch, Benefit Cap and recently the Work Programme. We are responsible for the IT implementation of electronic document repositories and e-signing as part of the digitalisation programme. We also manage IT projects which enable the interface of DWP systems with Local Authorities and HMRC.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: The team is responsible for delivery of National Insurance number provision delivering a robust and secure NiNO to domestic and foreign applicants. We also manage the Operational complaints, correspondence and feedback functions which includes: responding to MP queries, answering customer letters, undertaking peer and serious case reviews, responding to Parliamentary questions and Freedom of Information requests. Our failure demand and client assurance teams undertake quality checks on our delivery to ensure compliance with processes and assurance of quality service to customers.

Name: N/D
Job Title: Head of Strategic Design – Universal Credit Programme;
Job/Team Function: Creation of strategic design for UC including the strategic intent document; target and interim operating models; high-level business requirements; management information strategy and transition and migration planning.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: This team are responsible for the delivery of elements of the new child maintenance scheme. This includes the organisation design, site strategy and any third party contracts.

Name: N/D
Job Title: Head of Internal Communications and the Studio
Job/Team Function: Internal communications and the Studio exists to help staff and citizens understand DWP better, whether that is the services the Department offers or the part they play in making DWP’s objectives to reform welfare and pensions a success. The team achieves this through communications advice, planning, channel delivery (including the DWP website and intranet, DirectGov and Businesslink websites) and brand management. The team has a duty to fulfil the Department’s legal requirements to provide information to citizens which includes corporate publications (such as green papers), leaflets, letters, forms and display materials for Jobcentre Plus and Pension Disability and Carers Service.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Lead the Change Business Partner team that supports the UC Programme, develop DWP’s 3 lines of defence model for Programme assurance and implement 2nd line assurance activity for UC providing assessment of delivery confidence.

Name: N/D
Job Title: Deputy Director for Customers Service Delivery
Job/Team Function: Responsible for: Support for the live systems including, Incident and Problem management, Supplier performance management, IT Business Continuity and System ‘go live’ co-ordination.

Name: N/D
Job Title: Head of Private Pensions Policy & Analysis
Job/Team Function: Responsible for the policy, legislation and regulation that underpins the private pension system in the UK.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Part of the Social Justice Directorate (Strategy). The Division’s aim is to ensure labour market progress for disadvantaged people.  Our challenge is to work with partners, inside and outside of Government, to ensure that disadvantaged people move as quickly as possible into sustainable employment for the benefit of the individual and wider society.  The Division also supports the work of the independent Ethnic Minority Advisory Group.

Name: N/D
Job Title: Head of Provision Performance & Controls Division
Job/Team Function: The Provision Performance & Controls Division exists to improve provider performance and to set our future strategy for contracting, as well as providing support to existing provision. The Division is responsible for:- (1) The implementation of DWP’s commissioning and market strategy for contracted employment provision including localisation; (2) The performance and financial allocations for third party provision; (3) The monitoring and performance improvement of contracted employment provision including inspection and other assurance and (4) Analytical work across the commissioning and delivery cycle.
